abstract: The companies plan to spend $250 million to find ways for doctors to remotely monitor, diagnose and consult with patients.
snippet: The companies plan to spend $250 million to find ways for doctors to remotely monitor, diagnose and consult with patients.
lead_paragraph: Two of the nation’s technology giants, General Electric and Intel, are joining forces to try to cash in on the trend of delivering more health care outside hospitals and doctors’ offices.

headline.main: G.E. and Intel Working on Remote Monitors to Provide Home Health Care
headline.print_headline: G.E. and Intel Working on Remote Monitors to Provide Home Health Care
